tool_description: Evaluates patient conditions and assigns priority scores for diagnostic imaging scheduling based on medical urgency and condition severity.

patient_condition.description: Primary medical condition or symptoms requiring imaging

urgency_level.description: Clinical urgency assessment (emergency, urgent, semi-urgent, routine)

vital_signs_stable.description: Whether patient's vital signs are stable

error_messages: Invalid urgency level: Use one of [emergency, urgent, semi-urgent, routine].
Invalid pain level: Pain level must be an integer between 1 and 10.
Missing symptoms: At least one symptom must be provided.
Invalid condition: Patient condition description is required and cannot be empty.
Too many symptoms: Maximum of 15 symptoms can be assessed at once.
usage: Provide patient_condition, urgency_level, symptoms array, vital_signs_stable status, and pain_level to generate priority score for scheduling.

priority_score.description: Calculated priority score from 1-100 (higher = more urgent)

recommended_timeframe.description: Recommended timeframe for imaging (immediate, within 4 hours, within 24 hours, within 1 week)
